IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Apraxia Kids is the leading nonprofit that strengthens the support systems in the lives of children with apraxia of speech by educating professionals and families; facilitating community engagement and outreach; and investing in the future through advocacy and research.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Apraxia Kids is the leading nonprofit that strengthens the support systems in the lives of children with apraxia of speech by educating professionals and families; facilitating community engagement and outreach; and investing in the future through advocacy and research.
IRS990.Desc: During this period, 73,528 members joined our support groups sharing resources, utilizing our educational materials, along with seeking guidance from other families and professionals. We enhanced our website with more downloadable content, allowing for easier access to our free resources and education with over 1.1 million website views. We developed an interactive IEP Road Map (Individualized Education Plan) to help families navigate the often bumpy path of acquiring appropriate educational services for their child. This new FREE resource will guide families through the process and provide helpful information each step of the way.Our annual conference was held live and virtually in 2023, with 628 individuals worldwide in attendance. Virtual educational sessions and resources were available throughout the month of July 2023, following the live event. We provided 48 scholarships to families in need of support to attend our National Conference to fruther their education. In addition, we awarded 4 scholarships to graduate students studying to become a speech language pathologist.We continue to find ways to invest in community outreach developing statewide resources for our families. Our national Walk for Apraxia events were in person offering a virtual option for families to raise awareness and donations in 64 cities with over 7,000 participants. We continued our speech tablet program, distributing speech tablets and protective cases and applications to children from low to moderate income families. Apraxia Kids continues to support research assisting researchers throughout the world to recruit subjects for their apraxia research studies.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
Part II, Line 1 - Method of Accounting
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Organization uses the accrual method of accounting for cash grants, recognizing the expense as the grant's obligations are completed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The return is provided at the board meeting for all members to review.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Annually reviews the conflict of interest policy with each board member.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The board gathers data from independent, nonprofit salary studies and reports of similar positions at similar type, size, and scope of organization.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Governing documents are made available to the public upon request.

The Board of Directors has designated three months of operating expenses as a board designated operating reserve. At July 31, 2023, this amounted to $408,018 of the Organization's unrestricted net assets.
